oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Financial success of organic farms in Germany
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nieberg, Dr. Hiltrud
Offermann, Dr. Frank
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The conversion to organic farming is financially rewarding for many farmers in Germany. The majority of the organic farms make a profit above that of comparable conventional farms. A comparison of successful with less successful farms, measured by the average difference in ‘Farm Net Value Added’ to comparable conventional farm groups, highlights that the success of the conversion is less dependent on structural and site-specific factors than on the management ability of the farmers – above all in the area of marketing
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Nieberg, Dr. Hiltrud and Offermann, Dr. Frank (2008) Financial success of organic farms in Germany. Poster at: Cultivating the Future Based on Science: 2nd Conference of the International Society of Organic Agriculture Research ISOFAR, Modena, Italy, June 18-20, 2008.
